title.narrative: Emergency response to control a Red Locust outbreak in Central and Southern Africa (Regional Submission)

description.narrative: • One international expert on aerial control operation hired for up to three month and received the necessary clearance to operate in the target areas by early May 2009, • One international consultant on pesticide management recruited for a 1.5 month to work in the target areas by mid May 2009, • At least 10,000 litres of certified chemical pesticides in accordance with internal standards made available from remaining stocks in Mali and delivered to the IRLCO-CSA base in Tabora, Tanzania by mid May 2009 latest, • At least 800 kg of spores of bio-pesticide purchased and delivered by mid May 2009 to IRLCO-CSA HQ in Ndola, Zambia latest and is being applied in ecological sensitive areas in Tanzania, Malawi and Mozambique as required, • Vehicles hired, and various survey, spray, communication and camping equipment purchased and available at the site by early May 2009.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency response to control a Red Locust outbreak in Central and Southern Africa (Regional Submission)

receiver-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
